definitions.definition: at or during a time earlier than (the thing mentioned):
examples: You should always wash your hands before meals.
It was an hour before the police arrived.
He said he had never seen her before.
The letter K comes before L in the English alphabet.

definitions.definition: If a place is before another place, you will arrive at it first when you are travelling towards the second place:
examples: The bus stop is just before the school.

definitions.definition: If something is before someone or before a group of people, it will be formally considered or examined by that person or group:
examples: The proposal before the committee is that we try and reduce our spending by ten percent.
